subject: Re: [junit] Cactus vs JUnit
msgSnippet: On Wed, 29 Sep 2004 12:15:18 -0400, J. B. Rainsberger ... Vincent has frequently stated that Cactus is for *unit* testing servlets, not testing the application
messageBody:
On Wed, 29 Sep 2004 12:15:18 -0400, J. B. Rainsberger
<jbrains@...> wrote:
> grprabhavathi wrote:
> > We also foundthat Cactus is not that useful for testing UI as it
> > cannot do the navigational testing, i.e. navigating from one screen
> > to another.
>
> I find this surprising. If Vince Massol can read this, would you care to
> comment?

Vincent has frequently stated that Cactus is for *unit* testing
servlets, not testing the application as a whole, so he would probably
agree with this sentiment.

You might try using jWebUnit. It is a wrapper for HttpUnit which
simplifies many common functions.
